transcript:
Operator: What a wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: I would like a large caramel malt.
Operator: Large caramel malt, alright, anything else?
Customer: No, that'll do it.

Operator: Would you like to round up to note in the pocket?
Customer: Yeah, that'd be fine.
Operator: Thank you, we appreciate it, it's going to be $6.

details.feedback: Operator correctly recognized the upsell opportunity for a drink with the chicken strip basket and made a valid offer which the customer accepted, adding revenue. However, operator missed the second upsell chance to sell a paid dipping sauce and did not attempt any upsizing offers on either the regular fries already included in the basket or the newly added drink. A simple prompt such as Would you like that Sprite large today? or Would you like to make those fries a large for just a bit more? would have captured both upsizing chances. Overall: good basic upsell performance, but needs to remember to (1) offer all available upsells—in this case an extra paid sauce—and (2) always ask to upsize unsized drinks and fries to maximize check average.
details.issues: Upsell chance reference: Scenario VO-02 DrinkCB (valid drink offer when customer orders chicken basket). Upsizing chance references: Scenario VO-02 Drink (unspecified drink size) and Scenario VO-04 Side (unspecified fries size) from Upsizing Scenarios table. Menu item reference: 4-Piece CB Chicken (Strip) Basket (Includes a Regular Fries) in Menu Items JSON confirming 2 upsell chances (drink and dipping sauce) and 2 upsize chances (large fries, large drink). Difficulties: transcript does not clarify whether dipping sauce packets are charged or free; followed table which classifies dipping sauce as upsell opportunity. No size specified for Sprite, so considered a valid upsize chance. No conflicting instructions identified.

transcript:
Operator: Wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Hi, can I get the four-piece chicken strip basket, please?
Operator: Four-piece basket, all right. Would you like to add a drink with it?
Customer: I'll do Sprite.
Operator: All right, and then what would your dipping sauce be?
Customer: Can I get like four packs of ranch, please?
Operator: Yes, you can. Anything else?
Customer: That's it.
Operator: All right, your total is going to be $9.85. Would you like to round up to note in the pocket?
Customer: No, thank you.
Operator: Okay, pull forward.
Customer: Thank you.

Customer: I would like to get a small turtle pecan cluster blizzard in chocolate ice cream.

Customer: No, it's small.
Operator: Small. And you said you wanted chocolate ice cream?
Customer: Yes, please. I'd like to get a large cup of ice water and a regular-sized onion ring.
Operator: I'm sorry, I got the small turtle with chocolate ice cream, a large onion ring, and what else?
Customer: A regular onion ring and a large ice water.
Operator: All right, it'll be $9.29 at the window, ma'am.
Customer: Thank you.
Operator: Thank you.

Customer: Okay, do you have wet walnuts?
Operator: No, we do not.
Customer: Just peanuts?
Operator: Yeah, and pecans.
Customer: Okay, can I get pecans?
Operator: Yes.
Customer: Okay, anything else?
Operator: No, that's gonna do it.

Operator: Thank you, we appreciate it. It's gonna be six even.
Customer: You're welcome.

transcript:
Operator: The wonderful day, Dairy Queen. How can we make it yours?
Customer: Yes, I'll have a $7 meal deal, please.
Operator: Okay, will that be the three-piece or the cheeseburger?
Customer: The three-piece chicken.
Operator: All right, and what would your drink and sundae be?
Customer: The Mr. Pink for the drink, and I'd like to upgrade the sundae to a small blizzard, and I'll take the choco brownie extreme.
Operator: Got it. And the dipping sauce?
Customer: Oh, yeah. Honey mustard.
Operator: Anything else?
Customer: Nope.
Operator: All right, it's gonna be $9.74. Would you like to round up to note in the pocket?
Customer: Round up for who?
Operator: Note in the pocket.
Customer: What is that?
Operator: It's to help children in the triangle area.
Customer: Sure.
Operator: Thank you, we appreciate it. It's gonna be 10 even.

transcript:
Operator: What a wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Hi, can I have a chocolate and vanilla swirl on a cone, please? A kid's size.
Operator: Kid's twister? Okay.
Customer: And can we have some onion rings, please?
Operator: Okay.
Customer: And that would be just a regular size. And also, um, a small vanilla cone, please.
Operator: Small vanilla cone.
Customer: And also, finally, a Coke Zero or something like that?
Operator: Yes, we do.
Customer: Can I have a small one of those?
Operator: Small Coke Zero. Okay.
Customer: That's perfect.
Operator: All right, your total's going to be $11.54. Would you like to round up to note in the pocket?

details.feedback: Operator greeted politely and confirmed the order but missed suggestive-selling best practices. Because the customer specified a small size, there was no legitimate chance to upsize, so not offering a large size was correct. However, every Blizzard carries an opportunity to offer extra mix-ins or toppings, and this was not attempted. Including an additional-topping offer would likely increase average ticket while still aligning with approved phrasing. Continue confirming orders clearly, but remember to suggest permissible add-ons when size-up opportunities are absent.

details.feedback: Operator took the order efficiently but missed key suggestive-selling steps. Guest did not specify a size for the cheese curds, giving one clear chance to offer a large side, but no up-size was suggested. A MooLatte also allows a paid add-on of an extra flavor or topping; this was not offered. While no standard combo or drink-add opportunities existed, the operator could still have promoted 2-for-5 snacks or desserts to grow the sale. Remember: always ask if the guest would like large size when no size is mentioned, and present paid add-ons for blended beverages.

Future calls should include the scripted Blizzard upgrade plus large drink/side offers to maximise average ticket and meet suggestive-selling standards.

transcript:
Operator: It's a wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Just chicken, one second.
Operator: No problem, order when you're ready.
Customer: Okay, I'm ready. Can I get your $7 meal deal? Can I get your three piece chicken?
Operator: Okay, and did you want one $7 meal deal or two?
Customer: Just one.
Operator: Alright, and that's the three piece. What would the drink and sundae be?
Customer: The drink, I don't know, some kind of tea. Do y'all have any like, like y'all sweet tea?
Operator: Yes.
Customer: Is it good?
Operator: Yes.
Customer: Okay, can I get the sweet tea? And then the sundae, what's my option?
Operator: We have caramel, chocolate, hot fudge, marshmallow, strawberry, pineapple, peanut butter.
Customer: Can I do caramel?
Operator: Yes, you can. And the dipping sauce?
Customer: Barbecue and ranch. Is there a way we can put a little bit of, is it gonna cost extra to put a little bit of Oreos on top of that?
Operator: Yes, like 89 cents.
Customer: Okay. That's it.
Operator: Did you want extra on it?
Customer: Oh, no, it's okay. It don't come with no whipped cream, does it?
Operator: No.
Customer: Okay, that's it.
Operator: Alright, it's gonna be $7.58.

No items in the order qualified for combo or 2-for-5 so there were no upsell chances, but the Blizzard did allow an extra-topping add-on which the agent did not mention. Overall: 1 potential upsizing, 1 potential topping add-on, 0 valid offers made, 0 conversions.

transcript:
Operator: It's a wonderful day at Dairy Queen, how can we make it yours?
Customer: Yeah, can I just get a medium Reese's Blizzard?
Operator: A medium... I'm sorry, give me a second.
Operator: Okay, I'm sorry about that. You said you wanted a medium Blizzard?
Customer: Yeah, a medium Reese's Blizzard.
Operator: Got it. Anything else?
Customer: No, I'm good.
Operator: Alright, it's gonna be $6.05.
Customer: Thanks.

details.feedback: Polite greeting and clear confirmation of the order, but the operator did not attempt any valid upsell or upsize. The Blizzard already had a specified size so no upsizing chance, yet the operator still could have offered extra mix-ins or toppings, which would have aligned with suggestive selling best practices. Asking if the order was complete is merely a confirmation and does not qualify as an upsell or upsize attempt. Encourage the operator to remember to offer extra toppings for Blizzards and seek other add-on opportunities where appropriate.
details.issues: Referenced Menu Items JSON: Blizzard [Sizes: Small, Medium, Large] for item count, upsell 0, upsize possibility only when size unspecified, and add-on chance. Upsizing Scenarios: Scenario Null-02 confirms no upsize offer opportunity when size specified. No matching Upselling Scenarios for Blizzards. Additional topping chance derived from add-on field in menu JSON. No ambiguities or conflicts encountered; transcript was straightforward.
details.items_after: Medium Mint Oreo Blizzard

transcript:

Customer: Hey, I was just going to do a medium mint Oreo blizzard please.
